result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony Leo Conigliaro Jr

records.addlTxt: Signed by Judge Carter on 10/28/2022.

Non-compliance with DTC. Br. 4/DTC ONLY. 
EXT=CODE 3
Waukesha County DTC Diversion Contract signed by Judge Dennis P Moroney October 19, 2022.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

2:43 PM; Case called for Plea/sentencing hearing.  Defendant Anthony Leo Conigliaro Jr in court.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Anthony Leo Conigliaro Jr.  Prosecuting attorney Andrew Nesheim in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes parties have advised they are prepared to proceed today to a plea only as the defendant has been accepted into DTC.  State recites the offer.  Atty. Miller confirms the offer.  Court conducts plea colloquy with the defendant. Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1. Court accepts plea as, knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily made. Court withholds entry of judgment as the defendant has been accepted into DTC. Court approves the Waukesha County DTC Diversion Contract. Court will also order Count 2 be dismissed and read in.

8:52 AM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing.Prosecuting attorney Christian Farina in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony Leo Conigliaro Jr in court.  Attorney Cassandra A Miller Ms. in court for Anthony Leo Conigliaro Jr. Court notes the matter is before the court for hearing on defense's motion to modify bail and status.  Atty. Miller advises that as bond has been posted her motion is now moot, and withdraws her motion.  Court will accept the withdrawal of defense motion to modify bail.  Atty. Miller provides an update, she advises her client is in the process of applying and being evaluated for treatment court.  Atty. Miller requests a plea and sentencing date in about 30 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for plea and sentencing.
